website_summaries.verdict: Stylish, high-quality cordless kettle from a trusted name.
pros: Long -lasting, stainless steel construction, 1.25 liters, and a 1-year warranty
cons: Larger kettle, takes up more counter space than other models

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Terrible! Had it for 5 months and the lid has rusted! Looks awful!
customer_reviews.author: Victoria Reinhardt

customer_reviews.title: Purchased this product in Nov 2016, and it's no ...
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this product in Nov 2016, and it's no longer working after 5 months. I have to push down the kettle to make it connect with the base, and that only works sometimes...
customer_reviews.author: HelloKitty

customer_reviews.title: Buyer Beware
customer_reviews.text: I bought it because I love the KitchenAid brand. This was a great little kettle for the two months that it was operational. When it randomly broke, I requested a refund from KitchenAid but they have yet to get back to me. Poor customer service and the fact that the kettle isn't durable are why I give this a 1-star review.
customer_reviews.author: Dawei Wu

customer_reviews.title: After about a year and a half of light use ...
customer_reviews.text: After about a year and a half of light use this already stop working... disappointing I have a cheap Chinese made one at 1/4 of the price at work that still work. I bought this one to replace that one at home... and of course the warranty only last one year...
customer_reviews.author: Tuan Ma

customer_reviews.title: plastic inside, too bad
customer_reviews.text: thought I was buying an all stainless product, for clean water; nope, they put plastic inside. bummer
customer_reviews.author: Pono

customer_reviews.title: Broke in less than 4 months of very infrequent use
customer_reviews.text: I bought this in March 2018. The on switch is already broken and the unit no longer working. Really surprised at the shoddy quality. I have not contacted KitchenAid to see about a replacement, but I don't think stellar customer service is going to make me likely to purchase a similar product from them again. I used this one evening just fine and the next day it stopped working. Was not dropped or potentially damaged in any way. I probably used this 2-3 times a week in my home, so wasn't normal wear and tear.
customer_reviews.author: C Spratt

customer_reviews.title: This kettle creates a horrible chemical smell and taste in the water
customer_reviews.text: This kettle creates a horrible chemical smell and taste in the water, even after washing and many weeks of use. The smell and tase have not gone away; in fact, they seem to have gotten worse over time. When I smell the bottom of the kettle, the odor is particularly strong. It seems to be coming from the plastic part in the middle of the kettle. I normally love KitchenAid products but for this one, I am hoping to get my money back.
customer_reviews.author: lovemama

customer_reviews.title: Adorable
customer_reviews.text: This kettle is compact, but holds plenty of water. It looks to be high quality and is very attractive on my countertop. I'm so glad that I got this kettle. I wrestled with getting the Kitchenaid kettle with temperature control, but that one had plastic in the interior. This kettle has no plastics, except for a removable filter. I expect that this one will not leak, as there's no plastic window or extraneous seams.
customer_reviews.author: laurelissa

customer_reviews.title: Decent
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a kettle with no plastic and this was nearly it. Its definitely the best I could find so far. There is a peice of plastic inside that holds a filter. I don't care about the filter, so I just broke it and pulled it out. So now my water is not boiling with plastic in it all the time. I wish it was a little easier to clean. I may end up just getting an induction burner and a normal iron kettle in the future. Not sure why so many companies are putting out cancer plastic and non stick in all their products. I'd pay more money for something simple and safe.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: GOT CAUGHT BY THE DESIGN FIRST
customer_reviews.text: This is a simple but elegant design, with technical details that are very appealing. Base allows the cord to be stored so it's an appropriate length, kettle can sit down any way within the circle of the base without fumbling around. On switch is nice and simple, and auto-off is a big help - I have melted the last two kettles on my gas stove due to lack of attention. And, the color choice seemed especially lovely.
customer_reviews.author: RKS/jc

customer_reviews.title: The worst thing about this kettle though is that now after ...
customer_reviews.text: It heated up water quickly, but the other brand kettle we had before this one did too. The lid on this kettle is a major drawback, I prefer the flip style lid on our old kettle. The worst thing about this kettle though is that now after only 6 months of use I'm needing to replace it. We've been smelling something electrical the last two days when using it and today the pin in the center of the plug on the bottom of the kettle broke off. It looks like it bubbled and melted. Love my KitchenAid mixer that I've had for 24 years but this kettle is history!
customer_reviews.author: Mrs. P

customer_reviews.title: Heats quickly, Easy to use & clean
customer_reviews.text: We use this all the time for anything requiring boiling water. And, our teenagers use it for water for instant oatmeal or ramen noodles on the go. Heats up super fast. Solid, made of quality materials. At first I was emptying it everyday and making sure it was dry because another reviewer complained of rust. However, what I think they may have mistaken is that the metal darkens when heated. I always leave the water in it and have had it for several months... no rust! Excellent product, highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa

customer_reviews.title: Dangerous!
customer_reviews.text: After 1 month my kettle totally burnt out and melted on the bottom, very very dangerous
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good buy
customer_reviews.text: Really beautiful and matches my kitchenaid mixer. Slightly smaller than expected but works great. Only one small thing - this kettle seems sturdy and well made. Lots of stainless steel - except for the little lever you push down to start the kettle. Its silver colored plastic. I'm not entirely sure it's going to last long. Seemed odd, since the rest of the kettle is so well made. But I'm overall pleased with my purchase. UPDATE: I've had this for 9 months now and the little plastic lever is holding up fine. Also, this is shockingly easy to clean. Just wipe out any hard water residue inside. Comes right off.
customer_reviews.author: Lil Miss

customer_reviews.title: Too much plastic. Not fully stainless steel.
customer_reviews.text: I have been looking for a kettle that has no plastic that comes into contact with the hot water. Whether the plastic is bpa free or not, hormones leak out of plastic when heated. I thought this one was plastic free, but it wasn’t. The lid and pour spot has plastic. So I returned it. I ended up buying a Miroco kettle instead. All parts that come into contact with hot water are stainless steel in the Miroco. I love it. I found this Kitchenaid kettle description to be misleading. It is NOT fully stainless.
customer_reviews.author: AJS

customer_reviews.title: I love this.. but it just stopped working after 2 years.
customer_reviews.text: I was so happy with this when I bought it... It looks really nice on my countertop and it really served me well, been using it every single day... But after 2 years, it just stopped working... exactly 2 years... like there is a timer for it. I am so sad! Now i’m not sure if I should buy the same one or just move on to other cheaper product since it will only last for 2 years..
customer_reviews.author: Joann

customer_reviews.title: Form over function
customer_reviews.text: This is a pretty kettle if you intend to leave it out and like to make a few cups of tea or coffee at a time. It is not as convenient to use as must other electric kettles due to the old-school plug lid, odd pouring angle, and relatively lower water capacity. It does heat up fast and the construction seems mostly solid, KitchenAid quality. You can pick up the kettle after boiling without an oven mitt, but it can get warm. If you use electric kettles for making food, or other high-volume applications, this might not be for you. Otherwise, it's a perfectly functional and aesthetically pleasing kettle.
customer_reviews.author: Jordan

customer_reviews.title: Love it. Too bad the cord / plug is so fat.
customer_reviews.text: Have had this for nearly a year, I think... This gets used multiple times a day, every day. Love it. Good looking and works great. I do wish that it had a flat plug... since it's going to be on a counter all the time, and it's got this big thick cord and fat plug, it makes it a little ugly and unwieldy looking. But oh well. Just saw the comments about rusting. Going to check it out now. Ours always has water in it, we've never worried about it. Looked inside, checked it out, no rust.
customer_reviews.author: Crankydog

customer_reviews.title: The Best Electric Tea Kettle
customer_reviews.text: I looked high and low for an all-metal electric tea kettle and found it is surprisingly hard! This one fits the bill though, there's only a small amount of plastic that holds a mesh filter (metal) in place over the spout inside the pot. Some other reviews said that the water smells or tastes funny due to this, but i have not found that to be the case at all! The color and style is so cute on my counter-top, and it boils water so fast. I'd highly recommend this tea kettle to anyone!
customer_reviews.author: Kaylyn Bair

customer_reviews.title: Kettle
customer_reviews.text: Fell in love with this, but sadly had to return it as it wasn't quite the right shade of Red that I was looking for to go with everything else in my kitchen, otherwise a beautiful and very stylish kettle, and I love Kitchen Aid's products. So yes, I would most definitely recommend this.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Color does not match photos
customer_reviews.text: It seems like a really nice kettle but it was a gift and the color was the most important aspect. I paid a lot of extra money to get the deep navy blue. Even on the box the color was great, but when we pulled the kettle out the actual color is extremely flat and much lighter, almost lavender. It doesn't look so bad in the picture but IRL it's really far off, like flat paint instead of the glossy deep ceramic look of the photos. With so many kettles available the price was just silly ($80 for the blue version), I got a comparable one for myself elsewhere for $30 and it has worked great for years.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Form and function
customer_reviews.text: This tea kettle is perfect! Right size, heats water quickly and quietly, stainless steel with removable filter...and a timeless design. Fits my retro 1940 kitchen perfectly. It's a good size to hold plenty of water with a small footprint too. And as with all Kitchenaid appliances, I'm sure it will be bulletproof. I've had my stand mixer and toaster for over 10 years with no issues and they still look brand new too.
customer_reviews.author: Eli

customer_reviews.title: A bit disappointing, but it does its job
customer_reviews.text: For the price, it didn't even occur to me that this would be single-wall steel. As a result, the exterior gets *very* hot. I saw in other reviews that there some plastic on the inside, but I was willing to accept that it's very difficult to find plastic-free electric kettles. But I really so no reason that a well-designed kettle in this price range should not be double-wall. In addition, my previous kettles heated their full pots in 2 minutes or less, not the 4 minutes this one takes. All that to say that while the kettle functions as it should, I'm a little disappointed. It does not measure up to my Hamilton Beach, which cost about the same price.
customer_reviews.author: Clair L. Melton

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: I had one of these products years ago I was very pleased with it I am also very pleased with this product being very lightweight metal designing and it heats up very quickly and performs exactly as I needed very satisfied I recommend this product if you're looking to make instant ramen soup hot tea hot cocoa anything where you would need just hot water quickly I recommend this product it heats up hot water within three to four minutes to boiling point
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Dead after 20 months of use
customer_reviews.text: We chose this Kitchen Aid Electric Kettle for it's stainless steel design, but it was significantly more expensive than the Amazon Basics design which is 4 times cheaper. Failed after 20 months of daily use; will not power on. Perhaps this is an isolated defect, but an electric kettle is a very simple electric design and should not fail over a small usage interval as this. FAILED TOO EARLY FOR THE PRICE.
customer_reviews.author: Customer

customer_reviews.title: Broke after 1 year. Does not turn on anymore.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this product 1.5 years ago and the kettle is now broken. The kettle does not turn on anymore. The lifespan of this kettle is approximately the same as the warranty of 1 year. This means that at a price of $80 if I were to buy one roughly every year - would cost me around $400 over the span of 5 years. Also smells like boiled plastic because you are literally boiling plastic inside.
customer_reviews.author: Ruslan Parsegyan

customer_reviews.title: I love it
customer_reviews.text: Ive had this kettle for 3 years, I use it multiple times every day and its still going strong. I took it camping and it fell out of the back of my van and the bottom popped off. I put back on and its good as new except a couple of scratches. I accidentally put it on a hot burner of an old style coil electric stove top, slightly melted some of the bottom and its still going strong, that was over a year ago.
customer_reviews.author: Brittany S

customer_reviews.title: Simple and sleek!
customer_reviews.text: This thing is awesome. Heats up to boiling within a minute. Its sleek and simple to use. Makes boiling water a breeze, and I love it. Fill it with water to the line inside and hit the switch. Once I'm done I pour the water and let the steam dry it out. ** The one downside is that it doesn't recommend putting anything but water in it. I like to make ginger tea by boiling the root in the kettle and I'm worried I'll ruin this if I try. So keep this in mind when buying. It wasn't a deal breaker for me.
customer_reviews.author: Amy Wright

customer_reviews.title: Great little kettle
customer_reviews.text: I think this is a great little kettle. It heats water quickly. There is no alert when it's done, but the little light on the side goes out. I found it much easier than leaving the typical kettle on the stove. The kettle on the stove constantly had to be cleaned because of food splatters from normal cooking. The extra cord wraps neatly in the base. Best of all, the handle is cool enough to pick up with your bare hand. Also, the water doesn't want to splatter when you pour. This kettle is a bit smaller than the usual 2 liter kettle. In other words, it heats 1.3 quarts. If that's enough for you, go for it.
customer_reviews.author: Rich C

customer_reviews.title: Good buy - long time kettle user.
customer_reviews.text: My husband is the tea drinker and was looking for a kettle that had a larger opening in order to clean inside. This one finally fits the bill. We've used electric kettles for ages because of their convenience and speed. This one does not disappoint. Sturdy and good base compared to lighter cheaper models.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Holds up well to constant use
customer_reviews.text: I've had this kettle for almost two years and use it several times a day. I don't empty the kettle between uses so it always has water in it but I've never had any issues with rust. I have only had to remove and rinse off the filter once in all that time. I love that the handle never gets hot, water boils quickly, and the kettle takes up very little counter space. All that and it's so cute!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Looks really nice. 1.5ft power cable though.
customer_reviews.text: This kettle works well and is quick to heat water. Also it is very stylish. My only problem and the reason I'm giving this 4 out of 5 stars instead of the full 5 is due to the very short power cable. For some people they probably prefer a shorter cable if keeping the kettle right next to the plugs, but for my situation, I have cabinets that are above the plugs and the 1.5ft cable is just way too short. Almost worth finding a discrete extension for the cable.
customer_reviews.author: avery

customer_reviews.title: I love Kitchen Aid!
customer_reviews.text: Needed to replace our older Kitchen Aid electric kettle and went with this instead of the digital one we had previously. LOVE IT ! It's easier to clean and takes up less space than the older digital model . We use this multiple times a day and it's perfect! I have all Kitchen Aid 'empire red ' in my kitchen and I have noticed the newer empire red products appear to be a brighter red but they all blend really well and this was no exception .
customer_reviews.author: Real Elf

customer_reviews.title: Great solid kettle
customer_reviews.text: We use this kettle 5-6 times a day and it’s our second one...the first one last about a year and a half, which I think is good considering all the use it gets! It has a nice feel in the handle and is solid and holds right amount of water for us. We love the look of it too...does not look or feel cheap! Kitchenaid will replace if it breaks within the first year.
customer_reviews.author: Caleb

customer_reviews.title: Cute and quick electric kettle
customer_reviews.text: I hadn’t ever had an electric kettle before so didn’t know what I was missing! I drink hot tea all winter long, including when working from home. It is great! The water heats up very quickly and the shuts off automatically, a lot better than leaving hot water to boil on the stove and forgetting about it while on a conference call. I love the design and the bright blue color looks great on the countertop and matches my kitchen aid mixer. I thought the price was a bit high, but worth every penny
customer_reviews.author: avid reader from ATL

customer_reviews.title: Boiled water tastes like plastic. Don't buy.
customer_reviews.text: I really want to like this kettle as it looks so cute. The color is beautiful, too. However, none of that matters if the plastic filter inside the kettle is unremovable. The plastic is in contact with, in fact, soaked in the water when there's max amount of water in the kettle. The boiled water has a strong plastic taste that you can't ignore, even days after use. I'm returning it.
customer_reviews.author: Jane

customer_reviews.title: ) We are very happy with it and hope it lasts
customer_reviews.text: This kettle is replacing a Cuisinart that failed after I ran a little of water on the outside of the pot. It seems the lever assembly is very sensitive and a little water seems to cause a little corrosion and disables the on/off switch. This kettle has the same system so I am very careful to turn the water on only after the faucet is over the opening. There is no plastic smell as I've had with other kettles (even those which were virtually solid stainless.) We are very happy with it and hope it lasts.
customer_reviews.author: Portland Amy

customer_reviews.title: Plastic smell doesn't go away
customer_reviews.text: I bought this primarily for its looking. I read through the comments and noticed there is plastic part inside the bottle that will be boiled over and over again with the water. I had kettles from other brand with similar design before and the water doesn't have that plastic smell. After using this for a week, I detached the removable filter part and still getting a very strong smell in the water.
customer_reviews.author: Jacqueline

customer_reviews.title: Love this tea kettle
customer_reviews.text: This is the first electric tea kettle I have bought. I love it. The water boils quickly and shuts off automatically. I never have to worry about the water being "boiled out". It is made beautifully. I have since bought a second one in the light green color for my daughter. She loves hers too.
customer_reviews.author: quiltangel

customer_reviews.title: This kettle comes with a warning it can cause cancer
customer_reviews.text: This kettle comes with a warning it can cause cancer. Do you want to have tea and get cancer?
customer_reviews.author: Stepan

customer_reviews.title: Tea ready in minutes
customer_reviews.text: This is another gift I bought for my nieces’ wedding. She absolutely loves it. Heats up quick and it beats using the stove or microwave. Plus, the color is a beautiful pistachio. Love the color options.
customer_reviews.author: Carolyn Dawson

customer_reviews.title: sturdy construction. I'd give it a 5
customer_reviews.text: Extremely cute retro styling, sturdy construction. I'd give it a 5, but I think it imparts a bit of a metallic taste to the tea. It's not overwhelming, but it's there. I'm hoping it will diminish with time? It boils water very quickly, and pours well.
customer_reviews.author: MG

customer_reviews.title: Has plastic on inside not just steel
customer_reviews.text: This has black plastic on the inside to prevent loose leaf tea from coming through. Not just stainless steel on inside. Returning!
customer_reviews.author: Rachel Sum

customer_reviews.title: Like the all steal design.  Looks good.
customer_reviews.text: I most like that the inside has no silicone at the seams. I steam- burned myself a couple times the first week till I got used to the lid design vs my old one.
customer_reviews.author: Picky Picky

customer_reviews.title: In daily service for almost a year, no problems
customer_reviews.text: This is our second of these kettles - my mother took the first one for her apartment! We've had this kettle since April 2018 (almost a year as of this writing) and we use it at least once a day. No rust, no leaks, no switch failure. It has no manual temperature control, but it shuts off quickly after reaching a rolling boil so the thermostat must be pretty accurate. I cannot evaluate the energy efficiency without measuring the current draw and comparing that to other kettles, which I won't be doing any time soon.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: ... the plastic inside was not removable and I don't like to have a side of chemicals with my coffee ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought the item because it looks very functional but the plastic inside was not removable and I don't like to have a side of chemicals with my coffee every day when I heat water.
customer_reviews.author: Hulagirrrl

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely love this!
customer_reviews.text: So - you are asking yourself, why would I need an electric hot water pot? Me too - but it is really nice! Not only does it look great on the counter, but the water is hot in about 3 minutes - amazing! - and it shuts itself off. It may not be a necessity, but you will love it and use it!
customer_reviews.author: Lizzie16

customer_reviews.title: Great for heating up water VERY quickly.
customer_reviews.text: This heats up soooo fast! Best investment ever! Well worth the money! I use it to heat up hot water instantly for tea, oatmeal, cocoa, etc. so much faster than waiting for a tea kettle to heat up on the stove!
customer_reviews.author: California Dreamer

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and sturdy.
customer_reviews.text: This kettle is easy to use and sturdy. Not much to say, its not all metal, but it is practically everything i want of a electric kettle (easy to use and sturdy). The plastics seem to be non-issue to me in this case and don't touch the water as long as you fill it below the max line.
customer_reviews.author: Mika the Cat

customer_reviews.title: Great electric kettle that looks good too
customer_reviews.text: After a recent trip to China where every hotel room had an electric kettle we really wanted a nice one for the house and this one has definitely not disappointed us. The kids love being able to heat water for noodles, tea, hot chocolate, etc and we even found using the French Press for coffee easier now that water can be quickly and easily heated versus the stovetop kettle we were using.
customer_reviews.author: christineu

customer_reviews.title: Heats up quickly and a space saver.
customer_reviews.text: I had a Keurig. Was pretty pointless for me as I don’t like hot coffee. Love Kitchen Aid products and this warms up the water quickly and takes up less space on my counter. Also helps the empire red matches all my other gadgets
customer_reviews.author: B. M. Cousins

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful and safe kettle!
customer_reviews.text: Bought for my mother. She loves it. Minimal plastic parts inside the boiler, which makes this safer to use than others (this was a key part of us choosing this product over others). The looks are classic and beautiful.
customer_reviews.author: The Wills

customer_reviews.title: It sits on my counter and doesn't ever get "put away" and I like that it looks like a traditional tea kettle
customer_reviews.text: I admit I mainly bought this because of it's looks. It sits on my counter and doesn't ever get "put away" and I like that it looks like a traditional tea kettle. I really wish it held more water though. We can't get a cup of tea and my husband's coffee in his French press out of one kettle full. I guess maybe I should have looked at my water requirements first but the picture is misleading since the max full line is almost half way down.
customer_reviews.author: J. Noble

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: I was really surprised at the negative reviews, but I love this kettle! I like all of my appliances to match so I hunted down the pistachio kettle for some time, very pleased with this purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Emily

customer_reviews.title: Love the kettle
customer_reviews.text: This is a great kettle. The only reason I gave it 4 stars is that the handle is not hinged and putting the top off and on sometimes causes drips on the counter. It also makes it more difficult to clean. Minor, but if the handle could be moved out of the way it would be quite perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Bissie

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Kettle
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this kettle to heat water to brew coffee in a french press. The kettle is well made although the removable top is made of thin aluminum and heats quickly. I like the fact that it has an automatic shut off once the water reaches boiling temperature. The interior of the kettle also has a maximum water level marker that is a nice feature. I have been pleased with how quickly it brings water to boil. Overall, I am very satisfied with this kettle.
customer_reviews.author: RonT

customer_reviews.title: Loved this kettle (For 8 months or so)
customer_reviews.text: Update: After 8 months, the kettle no longer works. I expected better from a KitchenAid product. Love this kettle. My only qualm (and a very small one at that) is that the on and off switch doesn't completely click up when the kettle is done, but rather 30 min later (so you will hear the noise, though the kettle is and was off).
customer_reviews.author: Vault Dweller

customer_reviews.title: Love i!
customer_reviews.text: I love my new electric kettle. I like that it is not too large and clumsy, but just the right size on my countertop. It is classic looking and fits in with my kitchen's decor. It also seems to boil a little faster than my last one which I had for many years.
customer_reviews.author: Noelle

customer_reviews.title: Didn’t Last More Than a Week
customer_reviews.text: Product immediately started oxidize after first use... by the fourth use, rust spots were forming. No, I never left water in the appliance. Yes, I religiously dried it after each boil. No, I didn’t stray from the instructions or put anything but filtered water in it. Maybe I got a bad unit but I was expecting more from this established brand. Only positive was how it heated water at an above average pace! I have since returned it in exchange for a bonavita which is serving me well :)
customer_reviews.author: Kai

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: We use this constantly! Lots of tea and coffee drinkers around here and it has become a staple on our counter tops. I love the little rubber feet on the bottom so you can bring it to any table surface.
customer_reviews.author: Jake

customer_reviews.title: Stylish and a Fast Boil
customer_reviews.text: This teakettle is so Stylish and Well Made --I was not sure it was what I wanted but I am so glad I chose the Kitchen-Aid and a great price thanks to Amazon
customer_reviews.author: carol gorske

customer_reviews.title: Great electric kettle, but only lasts about 1.5 years
customer_reviews.text: I loved this product until it stopped working at the 1.5 year mark.
customer_reviews.author: Adria

customer_reviews.title: Great Kettle
customer_reviews.text: If you don't need to heat up a bunch at once (i consider this to be a rather small kettle, maybe 3 cups of tea at the full line) this kettle is perfect. Heats up quickly and looks cute sitting on the counter!
customer_reviews.author: Ashley Akins

customer_reviews.title: Works great, not "cobalt blue".
customer_reviews.text: This kettle is simple and nice looking design. It is not the KitchenAid "cobalt blue" of KitchenAid's other blue products which is strange to me. It is a lighter blue. Works great though! Cuts off automatically so it won't burn down the kitchen!
customer_reviews.author: LowerAmznCCRatesNow

customer_reviews.title: Rusted after a year and a half of daily use.
customer_reviews.text: Buy this product if you are okay with it rusting in a year and a half after daily use. I contacted the company and received no reply yet.
customer_reviews.author: Stacy

customer_reviews.title: Happy to have this
customer_reviews.text: Heats up quickly, but noisily - I actually like the noise, because I can tell how close the water is to boiling. It is easy to pour from when it's at least half full. When there is less water, it's a little awkward. I have to hold the handle from the back rather than the middle. The spout filter slips out for easy cleaning. I'm looking forward to many cups of tea!
customer_reviews.author: CJB

customer_reviews.title: Good if your careful?
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. I’ve had this kettle 2 months. Trying to avoid the rust issues other experience by almost immediately emptying out all the water, wiping out any excess, and then hanging it upside down to dry while it’s stjll hot. It’s slightly difficult since the kettle is still burning hot, but not impossible if your careful. The kettle works great, getting water boiling in a matter of minutes. Looks beautiful. I’m happy so far but will certainly update if issues arise!
customer_reviews.author: Lauren

customer_reviews.title: Never knew I needed one!
customer_reviews.text: I received this for Christmas to replace an old, busted version that I inherited. I never thought I would “need” an electric kettle, but it has been so useful. When the first one broke, I added this to my Christmas list. It looks nice on the counter and I use it to make tea and speed up the boil time on my pasta for rushed dinner nights. Such a great time saver!
customer_reviews.author: Postman

customer_reviews.title: Smelled Like Plastic
customer_reviews.text: I was really disappointed to see the amount of plastic inside the kettle, but I decided to give it a try. I boiled some water and it smelled like... guess what... plastic! I'll just get the cheaper Hamilton Beach kettle which worked fine for a year and has way less plastic inside. Also, the top is hard to get off because of how hot it gets. I burned my hand.
customer_reviews.author: Salma Akhtar

customer_reviews.title: Well made.
customer_reviews.text: I love that it Looks like a Tea kettle, I am very picky as to what sits out and I do like this. Heats things fast and very hot too.
customer_reviews.author: MLY

customer_reviews.title: Gorgeous and fast
customer_reviews.text: I love it. This is a beautiful addition to my counter, and seems to work faster than any I've used. I'm only giving it four stars due to the cost. I know it's a KitchenAid, but it was significantly more expensive than others. I just had to have the pistachio, which is why I splurged...
customer_reviews.author: othentic

customer_reviews.title: This kettle is adorable and a good size for me
customer_reviews.text: This kettle is adorable and a good size for me, but beware the handle on the lid which can heat up quite a bit and if you need to remove the lid after boiling the steam will hit you right on the hand (this may seem obvious but it's a danger that other kettle designs correct by making the lid pop open and putting the handle on the side.) That pistachio though? Too cute.
customer_reviews.author: J. Bird

customer_reviews.title: Nice product
customer_reviews.text: Love KitchenAide. This is a nice kettle. The one negative: the short; I mean super short, cord. Hard to find a place to plug it in.
customer_reviews.author: Jane Robinson

customer_reviews.title: Very nice color and quality electric teapot.
customer_reviews.text: Nice teapot. Matches my KitchenAid mixer. I waited until the price came down, but still expensive. It is harder to get water into it because handle doesn't move and gets in the way but has a strong 3 prong safety plug, unlike my coffeemaker.
customer_reviews.author: runnerjud

customer_reviews.title: cute tea pot
customer_reviews.text: very cute on the counter...light and easy to pour...doesn't hold as much water as the old cuisinart but it is so much easier to pour because it is so much lighter. i bought it again in case this one stops working.
customer_reviews.author: Renetia M.

customer_reviews.title: Quick and easy
customer_reviews.text: I have had other electric kettles but I like this one for the smaller counter space required. It heatstroke quickly and is also easy to clean the outside.
customer_reviews.author: Emma

customer_reviews.title: but I bought it for the design and color (pistachio) and am very happy with it
customer_reviews.text: If you are looking for a kettle with fancy functions this is not it, but I bought it for the design and color (pistachio) and am very happy with it. This is for my office and I use it only to tea. Then I have another KitchenAid Kettle at home (that I also really like) that has a digital display to show the water temperature.
customer_reviews.author: db1981

customer_reviews.title: Must have one of these!  Great for making tea, or using our Coffee Gator (or French Press).
customer_reviews.text: Safely put on a kettle to boil! Very fast, and much more convenient than a pot of boiling water. Turns off automatically when you lift it off the base, or when it reaches a full boil.
customer_reviews.author: Melinda Casado

customer_reviews.title: KitchenAid Kettle
customer_reviews.text: It has plastic inside the kettle that comes in contact with the water. Should be better quality for the price
customer_reviews.author: Z.Pan

customer_reviews.title: Too cute not to love.
customer_reviews.text: Love this little kettle. It is very efficient and fast. Perfect for me. In fact I’m so happy with it that I bought another one for my friend’s birthday. I also love the color and shape.
customer_reviews.author: jcshakti

customer_reviews.title: Awesome for small sinks
customer_reviews.text: I bought this cutie to use in my apartment. I have the master bedroom, and don't want to go into the kitchen area to have tea in the morning. Problem is, a lot of kettles are so tall, I can't fill them in my bathroom sink. This kettle was perfect. The over-the-top handle is a great design for my problem. I just thread the spout through the hole and fill it up no problem. Pretty and well-designed, too. Would definitely buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Lonnie E.

customer_reviews.title: Cute
customer_reviews.text: This is super cute and it looks just like the color pictured. It heats the water is a normal amount of time and looks nice on my countertop. Oddly, the cord came a little sticky - but it was easy to wipe down and hasn't been sticky since.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Buy it!
customer_reviews.text: Love this thing! I have a green one and I got back for my sister for Christmas. Went on sale prior to holidays...
customer_reviews.author: Linda Brennan

customer_reviews.title: this kettle seems the perfect fit with its style and robust design
customer_reviews.text: our last water kettles were poorly made stainless versions so we wanted to find one that would last and bring a bit more character/color into the kitchen. this kettle seems the perfect fit with its style and robust design. i will update again after we use it for a while, but we are very happy with this kettle in the first week.
customer_reviews.author: Maco

customer_reviews.title: Kitchen Aid brand new kettle rusting
customer_reviews.text: It's already rusting. I've had it for 5 weeks! I had the larger Kitchen Aid Electric for many years with no problems. I had one month to return this to Amazon and one week later it began to rust. Am I stuck with this rusty tea kettle?
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Electric shock water leaking through on off switch
customer_reviews.text: It started leaking through on off switch after 6 months but i thought it will be ok. Now it just stopped working after 1 year. Only 1 year. This is unacceptable. For the money which is not cheap you get crappy product which is very unsafe water leaking through on switch. People be very careful
customer_reviews.author: Mariusz Czapla

customer_reviews.title: Great Kettle. I hope the next design removes the ...
customer_reviews.text: Great Kettle. I hope the next design removes the plastic piece in the spout for the filter then its perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Xerxes777

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: Heats quickly. Stylish. Love that the exterior stays cool even when the water is piping hot. I only wish it had an audible alert when the water is boiling, but if you listen, you can hear the sound "change." It's not a problem, just a "wish."
customer_reviews.author: C. C.

customer_reviews.title: Cute and functional
customer_reviews.text: Very pleased with this tea kettle. It's good looking and doesn't take up very much room on my countertop. It heats the water up fairly quickly (if a little bit noisily).
customer_reviews.author: S. Fortener

customer_reviews.title: Pretty tea pot
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my 13 year old granddaughter. She loves to make tea when she comes to my house and was very excited to get her own. Good purchase.
customer_reviews.author: shopper911

customer_reviews.title: Not lasting even a year!
customer_reviews.text: I have not had this kettle for a year and it is already making weird noises. Really loud qrackle pop sounds.
customer_reviews.author: Earthmummy

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and reliable little pot. Buy it.
customer_reviews.text: Simply put- it does what it is supposed to do, and looks pretty nice as well. Sturdy pot. The water gets plenty hot within a couple minutes with one button press. There is no audible bell or noise when it reaches temp. Recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful
customer_reviews.text: I love this kettle. If it has to live on the counter, I want it to be beautiful and this hits the mark. It could be faster and larger, but those are minor and not worth any other kettle. I bought this one at a great discount because it was refurbished. 100% recommend, wouldn't have ever known it was pre-owned and was half the price.
customer_reviews.author: Maddie Black

customer_reviews.title: A great investment
customer_reviews.text: My favorite teapot ever. Super easy to use, it looks great, gets to a boil fast.
customer_reviews.author: S. Nichols

customer_reviews.title: Great product-poor shipping
customer_reviews.text: Great product. One downside is that it was delivered to us before Christmas in the actual product box. It was a gift and the surprise was ruined. I wish I would have known that before I ordered it so I could have avoided the receiver seeing it. Other than that the product is great!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Worked less than two years
customer_reviews.text: Beautiful little kettle. We've enjoyed using it for a year and a half, but it has stopped working. This is VERY disappointing, considering the time I put into researching kettles, carefully choosing this one, and taking care of it. The worst thing is I spent more on it than I normally would for a tea kettle... Oh and then there's the trouble we went through to retrieve it from our old house last month, having forgotten it on moving day. Because we liked it that much. Wish I'd kept my old stainless Oster which was still going strong after 8 years! The switch engages, the LED lights up, but tonight it stopped in mid-boil. Bought April 2015, kaput October 2016.
customer_reviews.author: Artmeliana

customer_reviews.title: Most noisy kettle i have ever seen
customer_reviews.text: I have just bought this kettle and was very exited. But it appears to be most noisy one i have ever seen and pours the water around. So, it is like a volcano. Water tastes strange too. Very disappointed, My 21 yearold kettle (philips) is much better even now. Do not recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Tamar Zandukeli

customer_reviews.title: Durable Kettle
customer_reviews.text: I love this kettle, did not know an electric kettle could be so good. It heats so fast and works wonderfully. A durable kettle indeed.
customer_reviews.author: Joy Thomas Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Would definitely recommend!!
customer_reviews.text: Love it! Quickly boils the water, looks stylish, keeps water warm for long periods. Great product!
customer_reviews.author: Mrs. Jackson

customer_reviews.title: It’s very efficient & boils the water quickly.
customer_reviews.text: Really cute!!!! Love the black color, it matches the decor in my kitchen. My kitchen cupboards are black. I only use an electric tea kettle. Very pleased!!!
customer_reviews.author: Marian Garrott

product_meta.title: KitchenAid KEK1222PT 1.25-Liter Electric Kettle - Pistachio
product_meta.description:
Color:PistachioThe compact KitchenAid Electric Kettle is built for speed, and quietly boils water in minutes. Single-wall stainless steel design has a removable lid for easy filling, an aluminum handle, rotating base, plus a removable lime scale filter in pouring spout.

BRAND STORY
By KitchenAid
feature_bullets: Smooth, aluminum handle with stainless steel body

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.6 out of 5 stars1,284 ratings4.6 out of 5 stars
